moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4: i was planning on playing the danish gambit if he took but...
moves.2... Bd6: ? honestly this is terrible, it blocks in the bishop and after the pawn takes the bishop is on a very weak square
moves.4... Nc6 5. Bc4 h6: waste of a tempo, trying to preempt 6. Ng5 and a queen, rook fork
moves.6. Nc3: taking advantage of the tempo he gave me to develop
moves.6... Nf6 7. Be3: loses a pawn but the bishop pair is worth it
moves.9... Qe7 10. O-O O-O 11. Rfe1: gives up the pawn for position and development
moves.12... d6: forced to prevent 13. Bc5 however, it can't defend bxh6
moves.13. Bxh6: discovered attack on the queen prevents gxh6, and now his castle is busted open, another reason why gxh6 fails is that after 14.Qg6  14.Kh8 15.Qxh6  15.Kg8 16.Qg6  16.Kh8 17.Ng5 his position is completely indefensible
moves.13... Qf6: forced, queen has no other safe and defending squares
moves.14. Bg5: forces the queen to f5 away from the king
moves.14... Qf5 15. Bd3: forces g6 because any other move results in Bxf5 or Qh7#
moves.15... g6 16. Qh6: the finishing blow because he has to move his queen and he cannot do so while defending Bf6 after which mate is inevitable
moves.16... Qxg5: he realizes he is finished so he takes the bishop
moves.17. Nxg5 Nd5 18. Qh7#: The end to a very satisfying game that was over at move 12, if you have any comments or see any way he could have escaped my attack feel free to message me
